title: Palm Beach Food & Wine Festival Returns to Host Resort Four Seasons Resort Palm Beach for an Intimate Culinary Affair December 10-13, 2015Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Palm Beach Food & Wine Festival Returns to Host Resort Four Seasons Resort Palm Beach for an Intimate Culinary Affair December 10-13, 2015 Published on : Wednesday, September 2, 2015
The Palm Beach Food & Wine Festival will celebrate its ninth year as one of the country’s most prestigious and delectable culinary and wine programs from December 10-13, 2015. Held at the quintessential Four SeasonsResort Palm Beach and at select locations throughout the Palm Beaches, the festival will showcase some of the world’s most renowned chefs and wine industry leaders through a collection of dinners, late-night parties, tastings and seminars.
This year’s festival features a star-packed line-up of culinary masters and food trendsetters. Returning chefs Robert Irvine, Marc Murphy, Christina Tosi, Johnny Iuzzini, Elizabeth Falkner, Anita Lo, Jeff Mauro and Ken Oringer will be joined by new additions Hugh Acheson, Gavin Kaysen, Dena Marino, Michael Ruhlman, Brad Kilgore and Beau MacMillan. Four Seasons Resort Palm Beach talent includes Executive Chef Tory Martindale, Executive Sous Chef Steven Conner, AB&G Chef de Cuisine Ricardo Amezcua, Graze Chef de Cuisine Jason Van Bomel and Executive Pastry Chef Bashar Al Shamali, alongside other Palm Beach County favourites Clay Conley, Tim Lipman, Sean Brasel, Lindsay Autry and Aaron Black.
Guests can take part in a bevy of fun tasting events at Four Seasons Resort Palm Beach:
Friday, December 11 (2:00 pm) Get Served!, the annual chef volleyball battle, rounds up teams consisting of sommeliers, chefs and other festival friends to remind them that kitchen skills don’t always determine the champions.
Friday, December 11 (11:30 pm) Turn up the volume with Late Night Rock hosted by Jeff Mauro , Food Network’s self-proclaimed karaoke extraordinaire, as he hosts fellow chefs and guests to an evening of cocktails and karaoke gone wild. (USD 75 per person)
Saturday December 12 (9:30 am and 11:00 am) Kids Kitchens presented by Whole Foods Market encourages kids to become the next generation of top chefs. Chefs Robert Irvine and Jonathon Sawyer guide mini sous chefs in hands-on classes. (USD 45 includes 1 child and 1 adult)
Saturday December 12 (9:30 am and 11:00 am) Chef Talks presented by VerTerra Dinnerware offers compelling culinary insights from some of the country’s most inspiring foodies. Two distinct panels made up of Hugh Acheson, Christina Tosi, Anita Lo, Ken Oringer, Elizabeth Falkner, Mike Lata, Johnny Iuzzini, Stephen Stryjewski and more will provide key conversations about the hospitality business, moderated by award-winning author Michael Ruhlman. Panelists are subject to change. (Media/industry only)
Saturday, December 12 (12:30-3:30 pm) Chillin’ N’ Grillin’ presented by The Gardens Mall makes its fourth year mark on the festival as chefs reinvent the concept of grilling in the blissful atmosphere of the Resort’s poolside terrace. (USD 125 per person)
Saturday, December 12 (7:00-10:00 pm) Street Food presented by SYSCO brings out the competitive side of culinary participants. In this street food competition, NYC-based chefs – Marc Murphy, Ken Oringer, Anita Lo and Elizabeth Falkner – take on five Palm Beach chefs – Tory Martindale, Clay Conley, Lindsay Autry, Tim Lipman and Dean Max. Prizes for People’s Choice and Judge’s Best Bite will be awarded. Special guest judges include Robert Irvine, Jeff Mauro, Hugh Acheson and Christina Tosi. (USD 125 per person)
New to this year’s festival offerings is an exclusive Palm Beach Food & Wine Festival Stay Experience atFour Seasons Resort Palm Beach, inviting foodies nationwide and across the globe to travel to South Florida for the most beautiful time of year. Starting at USD 699 per night, in addition to luxurious accommodations, a special festival welcome amenity and autographed Season with Authority: Confident Home Cooking cookbook by author/chef Marc Murphy, this package also includes an intimate private chefs dinner only open to package guests (Thursday, December 10, 7:00 pm) as well as tickets for two to Get Served, Late Night Rock, Chillin’ N’ Grillin’ and Street Food Fest.
This gourmet getaway is part of Four Seasons Hotels Food & Wine Festivals, a collection in which Four SeasonsHotels and Resorts is working with community partners to spotlight annual food festivals that offer one-of-a-kind experiences for consumers to indulge their culinary fantasies, which also includes Chef Fest at Four SeasonsResort Hualalai.
Additional Palm Beach Food & Wine Festival 2015 event highlights include:
Thursday, December 10 (7:00 pm) Sustain, a seafood-inspired dinner hosted at PB CATCH Seafood Restaurant & Raw Bar. (USD 160 per person)
Thursday, December 10 (7:00 pm) Expect to taste the unexpected at The First Bite with chefs at Clay Conley’s Būccan. (USD 160 per person)
Friday, December 11 (12:00 noon) Miami flair meets Palm Beach sophistication in Miami Takeover at Chef Sean Brasel’s Meat Market Palm Beach (USD 95 per person)
Friday, December 11 (7:00 pm) The official kick-off soiree Chef Welcome Party presented by Cheney Brothers returns to The Breakers Resort Palm Beach in all its red carpet splendor. (USD 125 per person)
Sunday, December 13 (11:00 am) Daniel & Friends takes Sunday brunch to the next level as internationally renowned chef Daniel Boulud opens his restaurant, Café Boulud at The Brazilian Court Hotel, for a mid-morning indulgence (USD 125 per person)
Sunday, December 13 (5:00-9:00 pm) 9th Annual Grand Tasting presented by Stoli receives a facelift with a new location at the fabulous The Gardens Mall in Palm Beach Gardens where more than 60 of South Florida’s hottest restaurants will serve up their celebrated dishes. Guests will also enjoy music from local bands and DJs, celebrity chef book signings, holiday-inspired displays, Stoli Mule & Beer Garden, a runway fashion show and more. For the grand PBFWF conclusion, the crowd will cheer on three local chefs as they compete in Grand Chef Throwdown Finale for the USD 10,000 prize. (USD 75 per person)
Source:- Four Seasons
